oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from John A. Hickerson to his father, John D. Hickerson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from John A. Hickerson, Company B, 2nd Arkansas Infantry, C. S. A., to his father John D. Hickerson. The letter is the first he wrote to his father after enlisting. The author describes his movements from Arkansas to Knoxville and back. The morning the letter was written, "Yankees came down river in two gun boats & fired upon us, without effect." He also reports that his brother Bill is with him and asks of the whereabouts of his brothers George W. and David.
